title: Rubick Guy will prob hate me for this suggestion: What if Sona's buffs worked like Fiora's Ult?
body:
Inspired by [this](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/uoBsBA2o-when-you-try-to-be-positive-in-gameplay?comment=0001) comment about Sona and positioning. 

So Sona would passively have her aura circle around herself with 4 fields like Fiora's ult. When she uses an ability she colors the aura blue/green/purple and the nearest guy on that quarter gets a buff. The quarter disappears. _Only procs on active or when 'touching' them with the **outer edge**_. So if two people are on one field and Sona has no Mana any more, she has to distance herself, walk around her ally and walk back to proc another field.  If Sona procs all four fields she gets Super Saiyan stuff, like her current passive on steroids or something. Fields reset one by one eventually (or all at once) so she has to keep up the beat(ing) to get the spiky hair. 

Uhm ... gives her a really high skill cap, maybe? She would keep the current "last spell gives bonus effects" effect probably, after all. Might make Riot like her since she's flashier so they stop nerfing her immediately  every time she's as good as any other Enchanter.

Edit: Could also be three fields because three basic abilities, positioning your active in a quarter pie might be too hard, and so it looks visually different from Fiora's ult.  

Edit: Could also be five fields since you can bump people. Or three to five fields increasing with level? Eh.

I actually don't think the divide would be _that_ great. It will exist, of course, but imagine Sona has four fields that she needs to proc and she has three low-cooldown basic abilities to proc them with.

 She can proc all four at once if her allies position themselves perfectly around her, of course, but getting all four in the mid to late game teamfights should be easy even without their cooperation. If she doesn't hit the active, she can still chase and boop them, especially with her E. That way, she'll only really have to really reposition herself for the last two fields, probably.

You can further balance it by tuning the fields' and reward's cooldown (so landing all four quickly is only ever relavent in clutch situations) and other aids (e.g. an E passive that gives her ms each time she procs one).

It makes sense for Fiora and Urgot to do as Riot didn't want to give them flat out broken damage but make them work for it (for their strengths) while Sona, being rather squishy and falling squarely into the support category, has nothing going on for her in order to benefit from this type of gameplay.

If this was the case, the same deal would have to apply to her - from Fiora's and Urgot's gameplay. If it was this tedious to keep her auras up, her auras would then need to provide a real hard benefit for a teammate. It simply has to pay off for how hard she'd have to work in order to keep it up. But that would mean teamfights would go horribly for Sona players who don't know how to do this while in lane, she'd still be a travesty and a lane bully, as she wouldn't even need to play her minigame to buff one or two allies (Marksman, a jungler and perhaps a ganking mid/top laner.)

So, it's an interesting idea... but is sona as a champion really designed to have skill expression?

Auras by nature are most effective by being able to just pop them off near your team mates. 

What if for Relic Shield it would only give you the proc or shield if your team mate was standing right next to you?  What if Soraka could only heal people if she healed from one side of her ally?

If you want to make Sona more interesting via the way she uses her skills the place to do that would be the power chords.  How and when you use those or adding more diversity to them is what makes a good Sona.  Particularly the green power chord, which used at the right time makes a lot of difference.

The auras need to work as auras normally do, otherwise your jumping around in circles trying to get them to work while your team gets mowed down.  It adds needless  complexity, much like Skarner spires.
